intro: Althaea pallescens, commonly known as the white marshmallow, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and showy, pale pink to white flowers that bloom in summer. Althaea pallescens thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks. Its common name derives from the fluffy, cotton-like appearance of its seed capsules.
